communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am researching all building, site improvement, & utility (including Water, Sewer and Storm) permits previously filed for the following address: 2139 S 7200 W and parcel #   14-22-101-013-0000. The records I am looking for are prior to 2021 to the initial issuance of the parcel ID. 
Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dennis Miller

title: Surveillance technology procured by VA law enforcement agencies

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Surveillance technology procured by VA law enforcement agencies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Department of Criminal Justice Services (DCJS) Summary Report on Surveillance Technology Equipment Procured by Virginia Law Enforcement Agencies, 2024, https://www.dcjs.virginia.gov/sites/dcjs.virginia.gov/files/publications/research/summary-report-surveillance-technology-equipment-procured-virginia-law-enforcement-agencies-2024.pdf, notes that 275 law enforcement agencies reported on their acquisition of surveillance tech equipment. The Summary Report contains tables describing their responses.

I would like to learn what tech each of the 275 agencies have acquired.

Please provide any logs, lists, reports and the underlying data sets that describe the names of the individual agencies and each tech item the agency has procured.  

If the logs, lists, reports and the underlying data sets are not extant, please provide copies of the completed reporting forms from each of the 275 agencies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Paul Tepper.
